task.title: How to Talk More in Class
task.shortdesc: Now that you are on campus, and made a new friend, it's time to start asserting yourself in class. The best way to show off your knowledge, and impress your classmates, is to talk as much as you can in class.

taskbody.context: This task will require you to speak your mind, whether or not you think you are correct. The best way to learn something is to be shut down multiple times!

step.cmd: Wait politely as the instructor begins the lecture.
Nod along and make assertive eye contact. Let the teacher know that you are paying attention.
Say "Yes, I understand," when the teacher asks the class about any questions or concerns and looks to you for guidance.
Raise your hand high and asseritvely (Figure 1) when the instructor opens up the floor for class discussion.
Talk about the first related topic that comes to mind.
Repeat steps 1-5 as you see fit.
